body: Interested in your opinions on what the first and greatest commandment means to you.
body_html: Interested in your opinions on what the first and greatest commandment means to you.
title: What does it mean to you to "Love God with all your heart, mind, soul, and strength"?

body:
To me it means keeping Jesus as my primary focus in everything I do.

Wandering thoughts - bring them back to Jesus

Procrastinating on some work I need to finish but don't want to - do it for God

Notice I'm scheming revenge in my head - pray for my enemies and trust God to take care of it
body_html:
To me it means keeping Jesus as my primary focus in everything I do.

Wandering thoughts - bring them back to Jesus

Procrastinating on some work I need to finish but don't want to - do it for God

Notice I'm scheming revenge in my head - pray for my enemies and trust God to take care of it

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: It's a full life commitment to God imo. Your heart, mind, soul and strength is all of you, so it's literally living for God first.
body_html: It's a full life commitment to God imo. Your heart, mind, soul and strength is all of you, so it's literally living for God first.

author.bio:
Faith, Hope, and Love is the path to Life, Liberty, and Happiness.

There is no justification for any human authority.
author.bio_html:
Faith, Hope, and Love is the path to Life, Liberty, and Happiness.

There is no justification for any human authority.

body: To make God your one and only king and to spread His kingdom everywhere and to all you encounter through hope, faith, charity, voluntarism, stewardship, trust, truth, and perseverance.
body_html: To make God your one and only king and to spread His kingdom everywhere and to all you encounter through hope, faith, charity, voluntarism, stewardship, trust, truth, and perseverance.

body: In the Hebrew Bible you'll find that love for God is always in the context of and closely connected to keeping the Torah. In Christianity it means nothing however, since Christians don't even observe the commandment to worship the one God alone. Even if the explicit link to God'# commandments is made in 1 John 5. But, like I said...
body_html: In the Hebrew Bible you'll find that love for God is always in the context of and closely connected to keeping the Torah. In Christianity it means nothing however, since Christians don't even observe the commandment to worship the one God alone. Even if the explicit link to God'# commandments is made in 1 John 5. But, like I said...

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity
